ygData.subject: more chapters for the novel
ygData.msgSnippet: Throwing is something that I love doing, so if I m twisting the 3 chants I m also generally (not always though!) too far away to use the wood elf fists of
ygData.messageBody:
Throwing is something that I love doing, so if I'm twisting the 3 chants
I'm also generally (not always though!) too far away to use the wood elf
fists of doom. Sigh, if only there was an autoattack for throwing... Yes,
damage is terrible: 4-9 pts and YES I've thrown my runed bone fork about 4
times now, but as the lone mage in our guild can tell you - it ain't
stopped me yet. :)

Targeted or not, DoTs can complicate large scale situations. If an
enchanter can't mes something because its DoT'd the only recourse is to
charm it (not always a bad thing mind you). I never target a mob manually
in those cases, we always have a main tank whom everyone assists off of -
however occasionally assist screws up by targeting a seemingly random mob
in the zone or it targets the wrong mob because of riposite. I always
double or triple tap my /assist [main tank] hotkey just to make sure.
Besides, with VoV/fbss and Dawnchaser/Partisan I do excellent melee damage.
Too bad there isn't "+hitroll" gear or I'd be really dangerous. LoS
really is a different type of guild, so feel free to disreguard what I
say... case and point: a wizard pulls in poh for us or we go door to door
trick or treating the houses because its fun. =)

Hum oh yeah Shada: sure 7/33 will get old BUT in EQ making a fashion
statement is oh so imporant. I'm trying to remember, he had blue boots,
yellow legs/chest/arms and black head/wrists/gloves... that sound about
right? Wolverine Woodelf here I come. :)

And as for RoK issues: I guess its just a matter of perspective because if
the rolls where reversed I sure would want the stuff I see dropping and
probably would try and buy it - so I don't knock anyone who disagrees with
my contention it should be nodrop, etc... but I hope you can see the flip
side of that too.

-Tork@Nameless

PS: For the curious: YES I DIE A LOT! =)
